channel.title: Chicago Audio Works
channel.itunes:subtitle: Audio from the University of Chicago Press
channel.itunes:author: University of Chicago Press
channel.itunes:summary: Chicago Audio Works brings you interviews with authors, archival audio, and more for books published by the University of Chicago Press in the sciences, social sciences, and humanities.
channel.description: Chicago Audio Works brings you interviews with authors, archival audio, and more for books published by the University of Chicago Press in the sciences, social sciences, and humanities.
channel.itunes:keywords: University of Chicago Press, Chicago Audio Works

item.title: Timothy D. Taylor on the Sounds of Capitalism
item.itunes:author: Timothy D. Taylor, Chris Gondek
item.description: Timothy D. Taylor interviewed about his book, The Sounds of Capitalism: Advertising, Music, and the Conquest of Culture published by the University of Chicago Press. Interview by Chris Gondek.

item.title: I Feel So Good: Big Bill Broonzy
item.itunes:author: Bob Riesman, University of Chicago Press
item.description: Bob Riesman, author of I Feel So Good: The Life and Times of Big Bill Broonzy, talks about the book.

item.title: Baseball
item.itunes:author: Gail Mazur
item.description: Poet Gail Mazur reads "Baseball" from the book Zeppo's First Wife.

item.title: Nocturne
item.itunes:author: James Attlee
item.description: James Attlee, author of Nocturne: A Journey in Search of Moonlight, reads from the book.

item.title: The Chicago Manual of Style
item.itunes:author: University of Chicago Press Staff
item.description: Anita Samen, managing editor at the University of Chicago Press, talks about the new edition of the Chicago Manual of Style.

item.title: The Wagon and Other Stories from the City
item.itunes:author: Martin Preib
item.description: Martin Preib reads from The Wagon and Other Stories from the City and answers questions.

item.title: Gerhard Richter's Life in Painting
item.itunes:author: Dietmar Elger, University of Chicago Press
item.description: A visual tour of highlights of the life of German painter Gerhard Richter. Gerhard Richter: A Life in Painting by Dietmar Elger is published by the University of Chicago Press. Narration by the staff of the Press.

item.title: Carol Fisher Saller on Copyediting
item.itunes:author: Carol Fisher Saller
item.description: Carol Fisher Saller reads from her book The Subversive Copy Editor and answers questions about Chicago Style. The Subversive Copy Editor and the Chicago Style Q&A are published by the University of Chicago Press.

item.title: John Dupre on Genomes
item.itunes:author: John Dupre, Chris Gondek
item.description: John Dupre interviewed about his book, Genomes and What to Make of Them, co-authored with Barry Barnes and published by the University of Chicago Press. Interview by Chris Gondek.

item.title: Brian Ladd on Autophobia
item.itunes:author: Brian Ladd, Chris Gondek
item.description: Brian Ladd interviewed about his book, Autophobia: Love and Hate in the Automotive Age, published by the University of Chicago Press. Interview by Chris Gondek.

item.title: Lennard Davis on Obsessions
item.itunes:author: Lennard Davis, Gordon Buffong
item.description: Lennard J. Davis interviewed about his book, Obsession: A History, published by the University of Chicago Press. Interview by Gordon Buffonge.

item.title: Steven Shapin on the Scientific Vocation
item.itunes:author: Steven Shapin, Chris Gondek
item.description: Steven Shapin interviewed about his book, The Scientific Life: A Moral History of a Late Modern Vocation, published by the University of Chicago Press. Interview by Chris Gondek.

item.title: Jan Van Meter on Famous Slogans and Catchphrases in American History
item.itunes:author: Jan Van Meter, Chris Gondek
item.description: Jan Van Meter interviewed about his book, Tippecancoe and Tyler Too: Famous Slogans and Catchphrases in American History published by the University of Chicago Press. Interview by Chris Gondek.

item.title: William Graebner on Patricia Hearst in America
item.itunes:author: William Graebner, Gordon Buffonge
item.description: William Graebner interviewed about his book, Patty's Got a Gun: Patricia Hearst in 1970's America published by the University of Chicago Press. Interview by Gordon Buffonge.

item.title: Consolations of the Latke
item.itunes:author: Ted Cohen
item.description: Ted Cohen's classic lecture from the 1976 Latke-Hamantash Debate at the University of Chicago. The text can be found in the book The Great Latke-Hamantash Debate by Ruth Fredman Cernea.
